description: Private component used to render placeholders in storybook and documentation examples

variant.description:
Secondary text style variations.

- `"inline"` - Secondary text is positioned beside primary text.
- `"block"` - Secondary text is positioned below primary text.
variant.name: variant

description: Visually separates `Item`s or `Group`s in an `ActionList`.

variant.description:
Style variations. Usage is discretionary.

- `"filled"` - Superimposed on a background, offset from nearby content
- `"subtle"` - Relatively less offset from nearby content
variant.name: variant

title.description: @deprecated (Use `ActionList.GroupHeading` instead. i.e. <ActionList.Group title="Group title"> â†’ <ActionList.GroupHeading>Group title</ActionList.GroupHeading>)
title.name: title

auxiliaryText.description: Secondary text which provides additional information about a `Group`.
auxiliaryText.name: auxiliaryText

role.description: The ARIA role describing the function of the list inside `Group` component. `listbox` or `menu` are a common values.
role.name: role

selectionVariant.description: Whether multiple Items or a single Item can be selected in the Group. Overrides value on ActionList root.
selectionVariant.name: selectionVariant

description:
Heading of  a `Group`.

As default, the role of ActionList is "list" and therefore group heading is rendered as a proper heading tag.
If the role is "listbox" or "menu" (ActionMenu), the group heading is rendered as a div with presentation role and it is
hidden from the accessibility tree due to the limitation of listbox children. https://w3c.github.io/aria/#listbox
groups under menu or listbox are labelled by `aria-label`

variant.description:
Style variations. Usage is discretionary.

- `"filled"` - Superimposed on a background, offset from nearby content
- `"subtle"` - Relatively less offset from nearby content
variant.name: variant

auxiliaryText.description: Secondary text which provides additional information about a `Group`.
auxiliaryText.name: auxiliaryText

open.description: If defined, will control the open/closed state of the overlay. Must be used in conjunction with `onOpenChange`.
open.name: open

onOpenChange.description: If defined, will control the open/closed state of the overlay. Must be used in conjunction with `open`.
onOpenChange.name: onOpenChange

anchorRef.description:
An override to the internal ref that will be spread on to the renderAnchor
An override to the internal renderAnchor ref that will be used to position the overlay.
When renderAnchor is null this can be used to make an anchor that is detached from ActionMenu.
anchorRef.name: anchorRef

description:
An `AnchoredOverlay` provides an anchor that will open a floating overlay positioned relative to the anchor.
The overlay can be opened and navigated using keyboard or mouse.

open.description: Determines whether the overlay portion of the component should be shown or not
open.name: open

onOpen.description: A callback which is called whenever the overlay is currently closed and an "open gesture" is detected.
onOpen.name: onOpen

onClose.description: A callback which is called whenever the overlay is currently open and a "close gesture" is detected.
onClose.name: onClose

overlayProps.description: Props to be spread on the internal `Overlay` component.
overlayProps.name: overlayProps

focusTrapSettings.name: focusTrapSettings

focusZoneSettings.description: Settings to apply to the Focus Zone on the internal `Overlay` component.
focusZoneSettings.name: focusZoneSettings

A custom function component used to render the anchor element.
Will receive the selected text as `children` prop when an item is activated.
A custom function component used to render the anchor element.
When renderAnchor is null, an anchorRef is required.

An override to the internal ref that will be spread on to the renderAnchor
An override to the internal renderAnchor ref that will be used to position the overlay.

anchorId.name: anchorId

addNewItem.description:
A menu item that is used to allow users make a selection that is not available in the array passed to the `items` prop.
This menu item gets appended to the end of the list of options.
addNewItem.name: addNewItem

type.name: Omit<ActionListItemProps, "id"> & { id: string; } & { leadingVisual?: React.FunctionComponent<React.PropsWithChildren<IconProps>>; text?: string; trailingVisual?: React.FunctionComponent<React.PropsWithChildren<IconProps>>; } & { ...; } & { ...; }

emptyStateText.description: The text that appears in the menu when there are no options in the array passed to the `items` prop.
emptyStateText.name: emptyStateText

filterFn.description:
A custom function used to filter the options in the array passed to the `items` prop.
By default, we filter out items that don't match the value of the autocomplete text input. The default filter is not case-sensitive.
filterFn.name: filterFn

items.description:
The options for field values that are displayed in the dropdown menu.
One or more may be selected depending on the value of the `selectionVariant` prop.
items.name: items

loading.description: Whether the data is loaded for the menu items
loading.name: loading

selectedItemIds.description: The IDs of the selected items
selectedItemIds.name: selectedItemIds

sortOnCloseFn.description:
The sort function that is applied to the options in the array passed to the `items` prop after the user closes the menu.
By default, selected items are sorted to the top after the user closes the menu.
sortOnCloseFn.name: sortOnCloseFn

selectionVariant.description: Whether there can be one item selected from the menu or multiple items selected from the menu
selectionVariant.name: selectionVariant

onOpenChange.description: Function that gets called when the menu is opened or closed
onOpenChange.name: onOpenChange

onSelectedChange.description: The function that is called when an item in the list is selected or deselected
onSelectedChange.name: onSelectedChange

customScrollContainerRef.description:
If the menu is rendered in a scrolling element other than the `Autocomplete.Overlay` component,
pass the ref of that element to `customScrollContainerRef` to ensure the container automatically
scrolls when the user highlights an item in the menu that is outside the scroll container
customScrollContainerRef.name: customScrollContainerRef

menuAnchorRef.description: The ref of the element that the position of the menu is based on. By default, the menu is positioned based on the text input
menuAnchorRef.name: menuAnchorRef

overlayProps.description: Props to be spread on the internal `Overlay` component.
overlayProps.name: overlayProps

alt.description: Provide alt text when the Avatar is used without the user's name next to it.

required.description: Indicates whether the checkbox must be checked

disabled.description: Whether the input group allows user input

The unique identifier for this input group. Used to associate the label, validation text, and caption text.
You may want a custom ID to make it easier to select elements in integration tests.

required.description: If true, the user must make a selection before the owning form can be submitted
required.name: required

description:
This hook takes no parameters and returns an `async` function, `confirm`. When `confirm`
is called, it shows the confirmation dialog. When the dialog is dismissed, a promise is
resolved with `true` or `false` depending on whether or not the confirm button was used.

A ConfirmationDialog is a special kind of dialog with more rigid behavior. It
is used to confirm a user action. ConfirmationDialogs always have exactly
two buttons: one to cancel the action and one to confirm it. No custom
rendering capabilities are provided for ConfirmationDialog.

onClose.description:
Required. This callback is invoked when a gesture to close the dialog
is performed. The first argument indicates the gesture.
onClose.name: onClose

title.description:
Required. The title of the ConfirmationDialog. This is usually a brief
question.
title.name: title

cancelButtonContent.description: The text to use for the cancel button. Default: "Cancel".
cancelButtonContent.name: cancelButtonContent

confirmButtonContent.description: The text to use for the confirm button. Default: "OK".
confirmButtonContent.name: confirmButtonContent

confirmButtonType.description: The type of button to use for the confirm button. Default: Button.
confirmButtonType.name: confirmButtonType

description: The `table` element where all columns and rows are rendered.

aria-describedby.description: Provide an id to an element which uniquely describes this table
aria-describedby.name: aria-describedby

aria-labelledby.description: Provide an id to an element which uniquely labels this table
aria-labelledby.name: aria-labelledby

cellPadding.description:
Specify the amount of space that should be available around the contents of
a cell
cellPadding.name: cellPadding

data.description: Provide a collection of the rows which will be rendered inside of the table

columns.description:
Provide the columns for the table and the fields in `data` to which they
correspond

initialSortColumn.description:
Provide the id or field of the column by which the table is sorted. When
using this `prop`, the input data must be sorted by this column in
ascending order
initialSortColumn.name: initialSortColumn

initialSortDirection.description:
Provide the sort direction that the table should be sorted by on the
currently sorted column
initialSortDirection.name: initialSortDirection

onDismiss.description: Provide an optional handler to be called when the user dismisses the dialog
onDismiss.name: onDismiss

Provide a unique id for the table subtitle. This should be used along with

Provide the scope for a table cell, useful for defining a row header using

description:
A dialog is a type of overlay that can be used for confirming actions, asking
for disambiguation, and presenting small forms. They generally allow the user
to focus on a quick task without having to navigate to a different page.

Dialogs appear in the page after a direct user interaction. Don't show dialogs
on page load or as system alerts.

Dialogs appear centered in the page, with a visible backdrop that dims the rest
of the window for focus.

All dialogs have a title and a close button.

Dialogs are modal. Dialogs can be dismissed by clicking on the close button,
pressing the escape key, or by interacting with another button in the dialog.
To avoid losing information and missing important messages, clicking outside
of the dialog will not close it.

The sub components provided (e.g. Header, Title, etc.) are available for custom
renderers only. They are not intended to be used otherwise.

title.description: Title of the Dialog. Also serves as the aria-label for this Dialog.
title.name: title

subtitle.description:
The Dialog's subtitle. Optional. Rendered below the title in smaller
type with less contrast. Also serves as the aria-describedby for this
Dialog.
subtitle.name: subtitle

renderHeader.description:
Provide a custom renderer for the dialog header. This content is
rendered directly into the dialog body area, full bleed from edge
to edge, top to the start of the body element.

Warning: using a custom renderer may violate Primer UX principles.
renderHeader.name: renderHeader

renderBody.description:
Provide a custom render function for the dialog body. This content is
rendered directly into the dialog body area, full bleed from edge to
edge, header to footer.

Warning: using a custom renderer may violate Primer UX principles.
renderBody.name: renderBody

renderFooter.description:
Provide a custom render function for the dialog footer. This content is
rendered directly into the dialog footer area, full bleed from edge to
edge, end of the body element to bottom.

Warning: using a custom renderer may violate Primer UX principles.
renderFooter.name: renderFooter

footerButtons.description: Specifies the buttons to be rendered in the Dialog footer.
footerButtons.name: footerButtons

onClose.description:
This method is invoked when a gesture to close the dialog is used (either
an Escape key press or clicking the "X" in the top-right corner). The
gesture argument indicates the gesture that was used to close the dialog
(either 'close-button' or 'escape').
onClose.name: onClose

role.name: role

width.description:
The width of the dialog.
small: 296px
medium: 320px
large: 480px
xlarge: 640px
width.name: width

height.description:
The height of the dialog.
small: 296x480
large: 480x640
auto: variable based on contents
height.name: height

groupMetadata.description:
A collection of `Group` props (except `items`), plus a unique group identifier
and `Group`-level custom `Item` or `Group` renderers.
groupMetadata.name: groupMetadata

role.description: The ARIA role describing the function of `List` component. `listbox` is a common value.
role.name: role

id.description: id to attach to the base DOM node of the list

renderItem.description:
A `List`-level custom `Item` renderer. Every `Item` within this `List`
without a `Group`-level or `Item`-level custom `Item` renderer will be
rendered using this function component.
renderItem.name: renderItem

renderGroup.description:
A `List`-level custom `Group` renderer. Every `Group` within this `List`
without a `Group`-level custom `Item` renderer will be rendered using
this function component.
renderGroup.name: renderGroup

variant.description:
Style variations. Usage is discretionary.

- `"inset"` - `List` children are offset (vertically and horizontally) from `List`â€™s edges
- `"full"` - `List` children are flush (vertically and horizontally) with `List` edges
variant.name: variant

selectionVariant.description: For `Item`s which can be selected, whether `multiple` `Item`s or a `single` `Item` can be selected
selectionVariant.name: selectionVariant

showItemDividers.description: Whether to display a divider above each `Item` in this `List` when it does not follow a `Header` or `Divider`.
showItemDividers.name: showItemDividers

disabled.description: Whether the control allows user input
disabled.name: disabled

id.description: The unique identifier for this control. Used to associate the label, validation text, and caption text
id.name: id

required.description: If true, the user must specify a value for the input before the owning form can be submitted
required.name: required

layout.description:
The direction the content flows.
Vertical layout is used by default, and horizontal layout is used for checkbox and radio inputs.
layout.name: layout

description: This is the private/internal interface for subcomponents of `FormControl`.

tags.param:
externalProps The external props passed to this component. If provided, these props will be merged with the
`FormControl` props, with external props taking priority.

description:
Make any component compatible with `FormControl`'s automatic wiring up of accessibility attributes & validation by
reading the props from this hook and merging them with the passed-in props. If used outside of `FormControl`, this
hook has no effect.
Make any component compatible with `FormControl`'s automatic wiring up of accessibility attributes & validation by
reading the props from this hook and handling them / assigning them to the underlying form control. If used outside
of `FormControl`, this hook has no effect.

visuallyHidden.description: Whether the label should be visually hidden
visuallyHidden.name: visuallyHidden

overflowStyle.description: How hidden tokens should be shown. `'inline'` shows the hidden tokens after the visible tokens. `'overlay'` shows all tokens in an overlay that appears on top of the visible tokens.
overflowStyle.name: overflowStyle

visibleChildCount.description: How many tokens to show. `'auto'` truncates the tokens to fit in the parent container. Passing a number will truncate after that number tokens. If this is undefined, tokens will never be truncated.
visibleChildCount.name: visibleChildCount

containerWidth.description: The maximum width of the page container
containerWidth.name: containerWidth

padding.description: The spacing between the outer edges of the page container and the viewport
padding.name: padding

_slotsConfig.description: Private prop to allow SplitPageLayout to customize slot components
_slotsConfig.name: _slotsConfig

bg.description:
The color utility parses a component's `color` and `bg` props and converts them into CSS declarations.
By default the raw value of the prop is returned.

Color palettes can be configured with the ThemeProvider to use keys as prop values, with support for dot notation.
Array values are converted into responsive values.

[MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-color)
bg.name: bg

borderColor.description:
The border-color shorthand CSS property sets the color of all sides of an element's border.

[MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-color)
borderColor.name: borderColor

border.description:
The border CSS property sets an element's border. It's a shorthand for border-width, border-style,
and border-color.

[MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border)
border.name: border

type.name: BetterSystemStyleObject & { bg?: string; backgroundColor?: string; borderColor?: string; }

tags.param:
root The element that will be the root for portals created in this container

onMount.name: onMount

containerName.description:
Optional. Mount this portal at the container specified
by this name. The container must be previously registered
with `registerPortal`.

loading.description: Whether the switch's value is being calculated
loading.name: loading

checked.description: Whether the switch is turned on
checked.name: checked

onChange.description: The callback that is called when the switch is toggled on or off
onChange.name: onChange

onClick.description: The callback that is called when the switch is clicked
onClick.name: onClick

statusLabelPosition.description:
Whether the "on" and "off" labels should appear before or after the switch.
**This should only be changed when the switch's alignment needs to be adjusted.** For example: It needs to be left-aligned because the label appears above it and the caption appears below it.
statusLabelPosition.name: statusLabelPosition

disabled.description: Whether or not the token is disabled (non-interactive).
disabled.name: disabled

text.description: The text label inside the token
text.name: text

id.description: A unique identifier that can be associated with the token
id.name: id

size.description: Which size the token will be rendered at
size.name: size

disabled.description: Whether or not the token is disabled (non-interactive).
disabled.name: disabled

onRemove.description: The function that gets called when a user clicks the remove button, or keys "Backspace" or "Delete" when focused on the token
onRemove.name: onRemove

hideRemoveButton.description: Whether the remove button should be rendered in the token
hideRemoveButton.name: hideRemoveButton

direction.description: The direction of the tooltip in relation to the trigger
direction.name: direction

type.description: Whether the tooltip content is used to label the trigger (like IconButton), or describe the trigger (most other uses)
type.name: type

as.description: Renders `UnderlineNav.Item` as given component i.e. react-router's Link
as.name: as

tags.deprecated: Use ActionMenu with composable API instead. See https://primer.style/react/ActionMenu for more details.

anchorContent.description: Content that is passed into the renderAnchor component, which is a button by default.
anchorContent.name: anchorContent

onAction.description: A callback that triggers both on clicks and keyboard events. This callback will be overridden by item level `onAction` callbacks.
onAction.name: onAction

open.description: If defined, will control the open/closed state of the overlay. Must be used in conjuction with `setOpen`.
open.name: open

setOpen.description: If defined, will control the open/closed state of the overlay. Must be used in conjuction with `open`.
setOpen.name: setOpen

overlayProps.description: Props to be spread on the internal `Overlay` component.
overlayProps.name: overlayProps

type.name: Partial<Omit<Omit<DetailedHTMLProps<HTMLAttributes<HTMLDivElement>, HTMLDivElement>, "ref"> & { ...; }, "height" | ... 7 more ... | keyof BaseOverlayProps> & Omit<...> & BaseOverlayProps & { ...; }>

groupMetadata.description:
A collection of `Group` props (except `items`), plus a unique group identifier
and `Group`-level custom `Item` or `Group` renderers.
groupMetadata.name: groupMetadata

type.name: ((Omit<GroupProps, "items"> | Omit<Partial<GroupProps> & { renderItem?: RenderItemFn; renderGroup?: ({ header, items, ...props }: GroupProps) => Element; }, "items">) & { ...; })[]

items.description: A collection of `Item` props and `Item`-level custom `Item` renderers.
items.name: items

role.description: The ARIA role describing the function of `List` component. `listbox` is a common value.
role.name: role

id.description: id to attach to the base DOM node of the list
id.name: id

renderItem.description:
A `List`-level custom `Item` renderer. Every `Item` within this `List`
without a `Group`-level or `Item`-level custom `Item` renderer will be
rendered using this function component.
renderItem.name: renderItem

renderGroup.description:
A `List`-level custom `Group` renderer. Every `Group` within this `List`
without a `Group`-level custom `Item` renderer will be rendered using
this function component.
renderGroup.name: renderGroup

variant.description:
Style variations. Usage is discretionary.

- `"inset"` - `List` children are offset (vertically and horizontally) from `List`â€™s edges
- `"full"` - `List` children are flush (vertically and horizontally) with `List` edges
variant.name: variant

selectionVariant.description: For `Item`s which can be selected, whether `multiple` `Item`s or a `single` `Item` can be selected
selectionVariant.name: selectionVariant

showItemDividers.description: Whether to display a divider above each `Item` in this `List` when it does not follow a `Header` or `Divider`.
showItemDividers.name: showItemDividers

renderAnchor.description:
A custom function component used to render the anchor element.
When renderAnchor is null, an anchorRef is required.
A custom function component used to render the anchor element.
Will receive the selected text as `children` prop when an item is activated.
renderAnchor.name: renderAnchor

anchorRef.description:
An override to the internal renderAnchor ref that will be used to position the overlay.
When renderAnchor is null this can be used to make an anchor that is detached from ActionMenu.
An override to the internal ref that will be spread on to the renderAnchor
anchorRef.name: anchorRef

anchorId.description: An override to the internal id that will be spread on to the renderAnchor
anchorId.name: anchorId

description:
`useMedia` will use the given `mediaQueryString` with `matchMedia` to
determine if the document matches the media query string.

If `MatchMedia` is used as an ancestor, `useMedia` will instead use the
value of the media query string, if available

Use `MatchMedia` to emulate media conditions by passing in feature
queries to the `features` prop. If a component uses `useMedia` with the
feature passed in to `MatchMedia` it will force its value to match what is
provided to `MatchMedia`

This should be used for development and documentation only in situations
where devtools cannot emulate this feature

disabled.description: Whether the control allows user input
disabled.name: disabled

required.description: If true, the user must specify a value for the input before the owning form can be submitted
required.name: required

visuallyHidden.description: Whether the label should be visually hidden
visuallyHidden.name: visuallyHidden

disabled.name: disabled

required.description: If true, the user must specify a value for the input before the owning form can be submitted
required.name: required

visuallyHidden.description: Whether the label should be visually hidden
visuallyHidden.name: visuallyHidden

description:
Render the component (a React.createElement() or JSX expression)
into its intermediate object representation with 'type',
'props', and 'children' keys

The returned object can be matched with expect().toEqual(), e.g.

```js
expect(render(<Foo />)).toEqual(render(<div foo='bar' />))
```

Render the component (a React.createElement() or JSX expression)
using react-test-renderer and return the root node
```

Get the HTML class names rendered by the component instance
as an array.

```js
expect(renderClasses(<div className='a b' />))
  .toEqual(['a', 'b'])
```
Returns true if a node renders with a single class.

This provides a layer of compatibility between the render() function from
react-test-renderer and Enzyme's mount()
Visually separates `Item`s or `Group`s in an `ActionList`.
Visually separates `Item`s or `Group`s in an `ActionList`.
Collects related `Items` in an `ActionList`.

header.description: Props for a `Header` to render in the `Group`.
header.name: header

showItemDividers.description: Whether to display a divider above each `Item` in this `Group` when it does not follow a `Header` or `Divider`.
showItemDividers.name: showItemDividers

description: Displays the name and description of a `Group`.

variant.description:
Style variations. Usage is discretionary.

- `"filled"` - Superimposed on a background, offset from nearby content
- `"subtle"` - Relatively less offset from nearby content
variant.name: variant

auxiliaryText.description: Secondary text which provides additional information about a `Group`.
auxiliaryText.name: auxiliaryText

description: Lists `Item`s, either grouped or ungrouped, with a `Divider` between each `Group`.

A collection of `Group` props (except `items`), plus a unique group identifier
and `Group`-level custom `Item` or `Group` renderers.

and `Item`-level custom `Item` renderers.

role.name: role

without a `Group`-level or `Item`-level custom `Item` renderer will be

without a `Group`-level custom `Item` renderer will be rendered using

Style variations. Usage is discretionary.

- `"inset"` - `List` children are offset (vertically and horizontally) from `List`â€™s edges
- `"full"` - `List` children are flush (vertically and horizontally) with `List` edges

tags.deprecated: Use the new Label instead. See https://primer.style/react/Button for more details.

A new filter component is in progress.
Until the new filter component is ready, you can use Button + TextInput + ActionList to reproduce this pattern.
UnderlineNav is deprecated and will be replaced by the draft `UnderlineNav` in the next major release. See https://primer.style/react/drafts/UnderlineNav2 for more details.

Use the `useSlots` hook instead.

createSlots is a factory that can create a
typesafe Slots + Slot pair to use in a component definition
For example: ActionList.Item uses createSlots to get a Slots wrapper
+ Slot component that is used by LeadingVisual, Description

description: Shows suggestions to complete the current word/phrase the user is actively typing.

Renders an overlayed list at the given relative coordinates. Handles keyboard navigation
and accessibility concerns.
Markdown textarea with controls & keyboard shortcuts.

value.description: Current value of the editor as a multiline markdown string.
value.name: value

onRenderPreview.description:
Accepts Markdown and returns rendered HTML. To prevent XSS attacks,
the HTML should be sanitized and/or come from a trusted source.
onRenderPreview.name: onRenderPreview

disabled.description: Disable the editor and all related buttons. Users can still switch between preview & edit modes.
disabled.name: disabled

placeholder.description: Placeholder text to show when the editor is empty. By default, no placeholder will be shown.
placeholder.name: placeholder

maxLength.description: Maximum number of characters the markdown can hold (includes formatting characters like `*`).
maxLength.name: maxLength

fullHeight.description:
Force the editor to take up the full height of the container and disallow resizing. Only
use when the container height is tall enough that the user will never want to expand the
input further, ie when it takes the full height of the viewport.
fullHeight.name: fullHeight

viewMode.description: Optionally control the view mode. If uncontrolled, leave this `undefined`.
viewMode.name: viewMode

onChangeViewMode.description: If `viewMode` is controlled, this will be called on change.
onChangeViewMode.name: onChangeViewMode

onPrimaryAction.description:
Called when the user presses `Ctrl`/`Cmd` + `Enter`. Should almost always be wired to
the same event as clicking the primary `actionButton`.
onPrimaryAction.name: onPrimaryAction

minHeightLines.description: Minimum number of visible lines of text in the editor.
minHeightLines.name: minHeightLines

maxHeightLines.description: Maximum number of visible lines of text in the editor. Has no effect if `fullHeight = true`.
maxHeightLines.name: maxHeightLines

emojiSuggestions.description:
Array of all possible emojis to suggest. Leave `undefined` to disable emoji autocomplete.
For lazy-loading suggestions, an async function can be provided instead.
emojiSuggestions.name: emojiSuggestions

mentionSuggestions.description:
Array of all possible mention suggestions. Leave `undefined` to disable `@`-mention autocomplete.
For lazy-loading suggestions, an async function can be provided instead.
mentionSuggestions.name: mentionSuggestions

referenceSuggestions.description:
Array of all possible references to suggest. Leave `undefined` to disable `#`-reference autocomplete.
For lazy-loading suggestions, an async function can be provided instead.
referenceSuggestions.name: referenceSuggestions

onUploadFile.description:
Uploads a file to a hosting service and returns the URL. If not provided, file uploads
will be disabled.
onUploadFile.name: onUploadFile

acceptedFileTypes.description:
Array of allowed file types. If `onUploadFile` is defined but this array is not, all
file types will be accepted. You can still reject file types by rejecting the `onUploadFile`
promise, but setting this array provides a better user experience by preventing the
upload in the first place.
acceptedFileTypes.name: acceptedFileTypes

monospace.description: Control whether the editor font is monospace.
monospace.name: monospace

required.description: Control whether the input is required.
required.name: required

name.description: The name that will be given to the `textarea`.
name.name: name

savedReplies.description: To enable the saved replies feature, provide an array of replies.
savedReplies.name: savedReplies

pasteUrlsAsPlainText.description:
Control whether URLs are pasted as plain text instead of as formatted links (if the
user has selected some text before pasting). Defaults to `false` (URLs will paste as
links). This should typically be controlled by user settings.

Users can always toggle this behavior by holding `shift` when pasting.
pasteUrlsAsPlainText.name: pasteUrlsAsPlainText

description:
Renders an invisible `markdown-toolbar-element` that provides formatting actions to the
editor. This is a hacky way of using the library, but it allows us to use the built-in
behavior without having to actually display the inflexible toolbar element. It also means
we can still use the formatting tools even if the consumer hides the default toolbar
buttons (ie, by keyboard shortcut).

disabled.description: Apply inactive visual appearance to the Textarea
disabled.name: disabled

visible.description: Use this prop to control visibility instead of unmounting, so the undo stack and custom height are preserved.
visible.name: visible

contrast.description: apply a high contrast color to background
contrast.name: contrast

validationStatus.description: Indicates whether the Textarea validation state
validationStatus.name: validationStatus

onLoadPreview.description: Called when the preview should be loaded.
onLoadPreview.name: onLoadPreview

loading.description: Show a loading spinner instead of content.
loading.name: loading

dangerousRenderedHTML.description:
Set the rendered HTML of the viewer. To prevent XSS, ensure that the source of this
HTML is trusted!
dangerousRenderedHTML.name: dangerousRenderedHTML

onLinkClick.description:
Called when the user clicks a link element. This can be used to intercept the click
and provide custom routing. Note that this is a native HTML `MouseEvent` and not a
`React.ClickEvent`.
onLinkClick.name: onLinkClick

markdownValue.description:
The markdown the HTML was rendered from. This is not used for viewing, only as a source
for change events.
markdownValue.name: markdownValue

onChange.description:
Called when the user interacts and updates the Markdown. The rendered Markdown is
updated eagerly - if the request fails, a rejected Promise should be returned by
this handler. In that case, the viewer will revert the visual change.

If the change is handled by an async API request (as it typically will be in production
code), the viewer should be `disabled` while the request is pending to avoid conflicts.
To allow users to check multiple boxes rapidly, the API request should be debounced (an
ideal debounce duration is about 1 second).
onChange.name: onChange

politeness.description: The politeness level to use for the announcement
politeness.name: politeness

description:
`Announce` is a component that will announce the text content of the
`children` passed in to screen readers using the given politeness level. It
will also announce any changes to the text content of `children`

politeness.description: The politeness level to use for the announcement
politeness.name: politeness

description: Provides an unstyled button that can be styled as-needed for components

id.description: The unique identifier used to associate the caption with an input
id.name: id

disabled.description: Whether the input associated with this caption is disabled
disabled.name: disabled

politeness.description: The politeness level to use for the announcement
politeness.name: politeness

hasLoadingIndicator.description: Whether the input is expected to ever show a loading indicator
hasLoadingIndicator.name: hasLoadingIndicator

showLoadingIndicator.description: Whether the to show the loading indicator
showLoadingIndicator.name: showLoadingIndicator

visualPosition.description: Which side of this visual is being rendered
visualPosition.name: visualPosition

description:
Provides a component that implements the "visually hidden" technique. This is
analagous to the common `sr-only` class. Children that are rendered inside
this component will not be visible but will be available to screen readers.

Note: if this component, or a descendant, has focus then this component will
no longer be visually hidden.

aria-labelledby.description: Used when associating the input group with a label other than `CheckboxOrRadioGroup.Label`
aria-labelledby.name: aria-labelledby

disabled.description: Whether the input group allows user input
disabled.name: disabled

id.description:
The unique identifier for this input group. Used to associate the label, validation text, and caption text.
You may want a custom ID to make it easier to select elements in integration tests.
id.name: id

required.description: If true, the user must make a selection before the owning form can be submitted
required.name: required

visuallyHidden.description: Whether to visually hide the fieldset legend
visuallyHidden.name: visuallyHidden

variant.description: Changes the visual style to match the validation status
variant.name: variant
